name: Marcus Ibrahim
core_wound: Worked 30 years in waste processing, body destroyed by labor, forced into early 'retirement' (fired when too injured to work), system used him up and discarded him
wants: To provide for his kids, to matter, to not be forgotten
needs: To realize his worth isn't his labor, to find new purpose
contradiction: Bitter about the system but still has hope for next generation, body is broken but spirit isn't
physical_description: Black man, Middle Eastern features, once powerful build now bent from decades of hard labor, chronic pain visible in how he moves, missing three fingers, gray beard, kind eyes, gradually stands straighter when pain is managed
skills: Community organizing from union days (before unions were crushed)
flaws: Chronic pain from decades of labor
Leveler use for pain management (becomes addicted)
Stubbornly independent, won't ask for help
knowledge_state_book1_start: History of labor movements on station

relationships.Reed Salazar: Buys Leveler from him, one of first to recognize Reed is doing something important
relationships.His children: Two teenagers he's trying to keep in school despite poverty
relationships.Yuki Tanaka: Mentorship relationship, teaches them to slow down
relationships.Dr. Amara Osei: She interviews him, he becomes key voice in her research
